intro: Peyrousia bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate peyrousia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Peyrousia bracteata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
